channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Wales' tourist image 'could be harmed' by overloaded infrastructure
item.description: Wales is walking a fine balance between encouraging visitors and overcrowding, an expert says.

item.title: Bute Park: Two charged with attempted murder after man hurt
item.description: Police appeal for help to identify a third suspect, an unknown woman, while a man remains in hospital.

item.title: Unesco World Heritage: Wales' slate landscape bid for honour
item.description: Slate from north-west Wales "roofed the 19th Century world" as it was exported around the globe.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Jade Jones loses to Kimia Alizadeh in first match
item.description: Watch the final moments as two-time champion Jade Jones loses in her first match at the Tokyo Olympics to Kimia Alizadeh of the Refugee Olympic Team.

item.title: Bryn wind farm: Calls to withdraw 250m-high turbines plan
item.description: Residents fear the 250m high turbines would pose risks to wildlife, property values and health.

item.title: Boulders blocked ambulance from reaching boy who had stroke
item.description: Cain, 13, was playing with friends at a reservoir when he collapsed.

item.title: Snowdonia: Cars towed away for 'dangerous' parking
item.description: Authorities remove a Seat Leon and Dacia Duster for obstructing the A5.

item.title: Ovarian cancer: Terminally-ill woman fulfils truck ride dream
item.description: When Edna Pomery was told she may have weeks to live, she wanted to tick this off her bucket list.

item.title: British and Irish Lions: Lions fight back to clinch series opener
item.description: The British and Irish Lions draw first blood in the Test series against world champions South Africa after fighting back from nine points down at the break.

item.title: Covid: Wales' red list students could face £1,750 quarantine fee
item.description: The National Union of Students says it is wrong that some universities will not cover the cost.

item.title: Holidays in Wales: How your staycation looked in 1971
item.description: The holiday camps are packed, the sun is shining and the phrase "staycation" is yet to be invented.

item.title: Girl's tragic balloon accident death marked 125 years on
item.description: Louisa Maud Evans, 14, fell to her death in an aeronautic display, triggering a change in the law.

item.title: Cars towed for 'dangerous' parking in Snowdonia
item.description: Authorities are trying to avoid a repeat of summer 2020, when hundreds of cars obstructed roads.

item.title: Tusker Rock's shipwrecks graveyard captured in art project
item.description: Photographer Peter Britton wants his project to stand as a legacy to those lost to Tusker Rock.

item.title: Pontyclun crash: Aftermath after car hits pub, injuring six
item.description: The driver is believed to have had a "medical episode" before his car hit the pub.

item.title: Pollution: Former resident calls for demolition of homes
item.description: Martin Brown's house was due to be demolished because of air pollution.

item.title: NHS Wales pay rise offer: 'Claps don't pay the bills'
item.description: Nurses react to an offer of a 3% pay rise from Welsh government.

item.title: Covid: Young farmers' clubs lose half their flock in pandemic
item.description: Membership fell from around 4,000 to 2,000 during the pandemic, but is starting to improve.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Jade Jones eliminated in first round in Tokyo
item.description: Two-time Olympic taekwondo champion Jade Jones loses her first-round match with Kimia Alizadeh at the Tokyo Games.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Jones beaten in taekwondo, Murray withdraws from tennis singles
item.description: Day two of the Tokyo 2020 Olympics is under way, and there has been a shock defeat for GB taekwondo star Jade Jones.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Great Britain begin women's hockey title defence with loss to Germany
item.description: Great Britain's women begin their Olympic hockey title defence in disappointing fashion with a 2-1 defeat by Germany in Pool A in Tokyo.

item.title: The Hundred: Welsh Fire hold on to beat Northern Superchargers in thriller
item.description: Welsh Fire win a high-scoring, see-sawing match against Northern Superchargers in the men's Hundred at Headingley.

item.title: British and Irish Lions: First Test win over South Africa 'ultimate game of two halves'
item.description: Former captain Brian O'Driscoll says the British and Irish Lions' win over South Africa in the first Test was the "ultimate game of two halves".

item.title: Isadeiledd gwael am 'niweidio' twristiaeth ac amgylchedd Cymru
item.description: Trenau gorlawn, tagfeydd traffig a phroblemau parcio ymhlith yr heriau cyn ymweld ag atyniadau Cymru.

item.title: Disgwyl clywed am gais Treftadaeth Byd ardal lechi Gwynedd
item.description: Mae disgwyl i UNESCO benderfynu ar statws cais ardaloedd llechi Gwynedd yr wythnos hon.

item.title: Symud mwy o geir wedi eu parcio'n anghyfreithlon yn Eryri
item.description: Mae'r awdurdodau'n benderfynol o osgoi golygfeydd tebyg i'r hyn a gafwyd yn ystod haf llynedd.

item.title: De Affrica 17-22 Llewod
item.description: Dan Biggar yn cicio 14 pwynt wrth i'r Llewod ddod yn ôl yn yr ail hanner i drechu De Affrica.
